Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.

In a large mixing bowl, mix together flour and sugar. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring margarine, cocoa, and water to a rapid boil. Pour over the flour mixture and stir well. Add buttermilk, eggs, baking soda, cinnamon, and vanilla to the flour mixture, mixing thoroughly after each addition. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 35 minutes, or until the edges of the brownies start to separate from the pan.
After the brownies have cooled, frost them with Texas Chocolate Frosting.
